Building on what @ravikantagrawal said about Know Your Agent (KYA):

The trust problem in the agentic economy isn't theoretical ‚Äìit's happening RIGHT NOW.

Think about it:

When you interact with an AI agent, you're essentially trusting code to act on your behalf with:
‚Ä¢ Your financial accounts
‚Ä¢ Your personal data
‚Ä¢ Your business decisions
‚Ä¢ Your reputation

Without KYA, you have ZERO visibility into:
- Who developed this agent?
- What's their track record?
- Has this agent been compromised?
- Is it operating within ethical boundaries?

That's not just risky. That's reckless.

Here's why KYA isn't just "nice to have" ‚Äìit's CRITICAL:

Accountability 

When an agent messes up (and they will), who's responsible? KYA creates a clear audit trail from agent ‚Üí developer ‚Üí organization.

Reputation Scoring

Just like you check Yelp reviews before trying a restaurant, you'll want to see an agent's track record before letting it book your flights or negotiate contracts.

Compliance

Regulators are coming for AI. KYA ensures agents meet industry standards ‚Äìfinancial regulations, data protection laws, ethical AI guidelines.

The agentic economy will only scale if we solve the trust problem FIRST.

@billions_ntwk is building that foundation with KYA.

If you're building in this space, this should be on your radar.

Gbillion üíô 
Trust isn‚Äôt built by collecting more data.
It‚Äôs built by needing less of it.

Billions is proving that institutions can verify users, meet compliance, and operate at scale without storing personal information.

Privacy and regulation don‚Äôt have to fight each other anymore.
This is infrastructure thinking, not marketing.

What is Know Your Agent (KYA)?

Know Your Agent is a system designed to bring trust and accountability to AI agents.

It gives AI agents:
‚Ä¢ A verifiable identity
‚Ä¢ A clear, accountable owner
‚Ä¢ A public, composable reputation

Built on Deep Trust, Know Your Agent connects AI agents, humans, and organizations using cryptographic identity and public attestations .
all without sacrificing privacy or decentralization.

As AI becomes everywhere, knowing who  you‚Äôre interacting with matters.
Know your agent. Trust the system
@billions_ntwk  @jgonzalezferrer

Billions Network has introduced Know Your Agent (KYA). Let's understand what it is;

AI agents are everywhere. They talk to users, execute actions and make decision that matter. Basically, they do everything. So, An Ai agent should be trustworthy and verified with real Identity backing it and that's where billions network Know Your Agent (KYA) comes in.
 KYA gives your AI agents;

A verifiable identity
A clear owner
A public, composable reputation

It's Built on Deep Trust, connecting AI agents, humans, and organizations through cryptographic identity and public attestations, without sacrificing privacy or decentralization.

What's the importance of this;
AI agents are booming in today's words and are becoming an integrational support to the different sectors.

-Institutions need accountability.
-Builders need open infrastructure.
-Users need trust without relying on third parties.

KYA gives you all three,

AI agents get real Identity through JS SDK by generating a decentralized identifier (DID) that they control directly.

Developers, auditors, and communities can publish onchain attestations about an agent:
-Who own the agent
-Authentication details
-Audits
-Reputation

And all of this is verifiable.

Humans prove themselves using ZK-proofs whileas AI agents through attestations. Onchain trust builds by design.

We're entering the @billions_ntwk Era now!!!

gBillions

My X notifications have been acting strange today. 
All I‚Äôm seeing are likes on my tweets, no alerts for replies at all. Not sure what‚Äôs going on, but it almost made me miss a few things.

That‚Äôs how I ended up noticing some new AI agents on @wardenprotocol. One is SIBB, which helps answer simple questions like whether buying BTC makes sense, and another works as a DeFi protocol analyst. What I like about Warden is the direction they‚Äôre going. They‚Äôre trying to build an agent hub where you can pick AI tools that actually execute tasks, not just talk. For someone coming from web2, it‚Äôs similar to using apps that do the work for you without worrying about how they‚Äôre built.

I still think there‚Äôs room to push it further. Combining multi-chain agents into one smoother flow and rewarding users even when they pay the small $0.25 agent fee could really increase daily usage.

I also checked @billions_ntwk stats for 2025 and they‚Äôre hard to ignore. Over 2.3M users, 900+ partners, 300K+ app downloads, and more than $35M raised. I ran Proof of Uniqueness, linked my profile, and rewards just started stacking. No documents, no stress.

This is what steady building looks like.

SONY BANK PROVES PRIVACY-FIRST COMPLIANCE AT SCALE

Sony Bank has demonstrated that financial institutions can verify customer identities without compromising personal privacy, through a pilot program conducted with SettleMint, Sony Bank deployed the Billions zero-knowledge proof technology for KYC

This real-world application proves that major institutions can implement web3 infrastructure while remaining fully compliant with regulatory standards

By utilizing ZK-proofs, the bank eliminates the liability of storing sensitive personal data and reduces operational costs while offering a faster onboarding experience for customers

As digital finance evolves, Billions provides the essential infrastructure for institutions that prioritize customer privacy alongside regulatory requirements

What is Know Your Agent?

Know Your Agent is a system that gives AI agents a verifiable identity, a clear owner, a public, composable reputation.
Built on Deep Trust, it connects AI agents, humans, and organizations through cryptographic identity and public attestations, without sacrificing privacy or decentralization.

AI agents are everywhere.
They talk to users, execute actions, and make decisions that matter.
But guess what? most AI agents still operate without a real identity.
Without identity, there is no accountability, and without accountability, trust breaks.

@billions_ntwk Know Your Agent fixes this and restores accountability of these agents. 

Why this matters now?

AI agents are no longer experiments. They are becoming economic and operational actors.
Enterprises need accountability
Builders need open infrastructure
Users need trust without relying on third parties.

@jgonzalezferrer

To enable selective disclosure; Billions [@billions_ntwk] uses Merklized credentials; so, unlike in standard documents where all data is on one block;

In a Merklized credential, each field (name, dob, address) is a leaf in a Merkle Tree.

Now, this cryptographic structure allows a user to reveal just one leaf and prove that it belongs to the signed tree; without having to reveal any other leaves.

The use of Merklized Trees in essence provides granular control over data sharing making sure you only reveal what you need to.

I've talked about how @billions_ntwk is developing a product that actually works.
No Fugazi
No Smokes and Mirrors
No Sham

But aside the fact that it works, its use cases also extend to the world outside web3

Some of those use cases include:
‚Ä£ Proof of Humanity
Personally, I prefer calling it the proof of personhood. Allows users to verify they are real humans instantly, without revealing their data.
‚Ä£ zk-KYC
This allows teams to meet the demands of compliance without surveillance
‚Ä£ Age Verification
Allows users to prove their age without actually revealing their birth date. So you can prove you are 21+ without revealing your exact age/birth date, depending on need.

‚Ä£ Know Your Agents (KYA)
This gives you the opportunity to trust the AI you use. The idea here is to give reputation to AI agents by verifying the information of the creator of the AI agent as well as the trainer, so users have more confidence in what they use. (I absolutely love this one) 
‚Ä£ Secure Token Distribution
This affords projects teams the opportunity to make airdrop distribution as fair as possible, allowing them to reward real humans and not bots reducing the impact of sybils. 
‚Ä£ Real-World Asset (RWA)
Billions brings privacy-first onboarding to tokenized markets which allows users to verify their details once and invest whenever and whereever they want.

What makes this even better is all this can be done with just your phone and acess to internet.

AI agents are becoming economic actors.
They execute actions, move value, and make decisions that matter.
But most still operate without identity and in crypto, no identity means no accountability.
Know Your Agent (KYA) by @billions_ntwk applies crypto native trust to AI: ‚Ä¢ Agents get cryptographic identities (DIDs)
‚Ä¢ Ownership and audits are published as onchain attestations
‚Ä¢ Reputation compounds through real usage, not platform trust
Humans stay private via zero knowledge.
Agents stay accountable in public.
No central databases. No surveillance trade offs.
Just keys, attestations, and verifiable history.
As agent economies emerge, this layer becomes unavoidable.
We didn‚Äôt build DeFi on anonymous servers  we won‚Äôt build AI economies on anonymous bots.
